Detailed Description

template<class T = double> template class LowpassFilter

The class LowpassFilter implements the template Filtering class.

A second order Low-Pass ButterWorth Filter is implemented to filter out low frequency noise inherited from time derivative calculations, measurement errors and noisy sensors.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform.
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package      : The Math Library
// Authors      : 
// Start Date   : Wed Dec 20 11:08:28 GMT 2000
// Compiler     : GNU C++
// Operating System : QNX RTP
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: LowpassFilter.t.cpp
// Example program for the high-pass filter class.
//========================================================================  


//========================================================================
// LowpassFilter.t.cpp
//------------------------------------------------------------------------
// \brief
// The file LowpassFilter.t.cpp is an example program that tests the 
// LowpassFilter class provided with the robotic Platform
// This program generates a sin wave with random noise 
// inserted on it , then using the LowpassFilter class 
// the noise will be suppressed. Outputs are saved as ascii 
// files  enabling the user to check the input and filtered signals.
//========================================================================

#include "LowpassFilter.hpp"

#include <iostream.h>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

#define PI 3.14

 double wn = 3; //cutoff frequency in hertz.
 double damp =1.0;
 double dirtySignal[1000];
 double filteredSignal[1000];
 double p ;

 //define Filter
 LowpassFilter<double>  velocityFilter (wn, 0.001, damp);
 
main ()
{
  FILE *outfile1, *outfile2;
  velocityFilter.initializeFilter(0.0, 0.0);
  outfile1 = fopen("dirtybutter.dat", "w+");
  outfile2 = fopen("cleanbutter.dat", "w+");

 for (int i=0; i<1000; i++)
 {
   p = ((double)i)/1000.0; 
   dirtySignal[i] = 2 + sin(2*PI*p) + ((double)rand()/100000);
   filteredSignal[i] = velocityFilter.filter(dirtySignal[i]);
    
   // noise[i] = filteredSignal[i] - dirtySignal[i];

   // simply write the outputs to a file and check it using matlab... 
     fprintf(outfile1, "%f \n", dirtySignal[i]);
     fprintf(outfile2, "%f \n", filteredSignal[i]);
 }

 fclose(outfile1);
 fclose(outfile2);

return(0);
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

LowpassFilter ( ) [inline]
 

The default Constructor. Sets cut-off frequency to 1 Hertz and sampling period to 0.001 sec. The damping ratio is set to 1.

LowpassFilter ( double cutOffFrequencyHz,
double samplingPeriod,
double dampingFactor = 1 )
 

This constructor for the filter initializes the parameters of the filter.

Parameters:
cutOffFrequencyHz   The cut-off frequency of the low pass butterworth filter in hertz.
samplingPeriod   The sampling period of the filter in seconds.
dampingFactor   Desired damping ratio.(default value of 1 if parameter not passed)

~LowpassFilter ( ) [inline]
 

The default destructor.

Sets the damping factor of the butterworth filter.
